page.title: 01WISBOROUGH GREEN
page.content: Wisborough Green is situated on the A272 between Petworth and Billingshurst.In the centre of the village is a large green surrounded by chestnut trees.Many tourists come in summer to picnic,pick soft fruit or look over the ancient church. Many people retire to the village and live in its well preserved cottages. The area is predominantly rural with a lot of grassland and woods.Many people keep horses and there is a certain amount of cereal growing and horticulture. The name of the village has always been associated with cricket which is played on the green in summer.
